# finishRunningWithError(_:)

**Instance Method**

Causes the action to stop running and return an error, which, in turn, causes the workflow to stop.

## Declaration

```swift
func finishRunningWithError(_ error: (any Error)?)
```

## Parameters

- **error**: The error to be returned to Automator.

## Discussion

Call this method on any action that overrides [doc://com.apple.automator/documentation/Automator/AMAction/runAsynchronously(withInput:)] in order to make asynchronous calls. When [doc://com.apple.automator/documentation/Automator/AMAction/finishRunningWithError(_:)] is invoked, it immediately calls [doc://com.apple.automator/documentation/Automator/AMAction/willFinishRunning()].

## Controlling the Action

- **run(withInput:)**: Requests the action to perform its task using the specified input.
- **runAsynchronously(withInput:)**: Causes Automator to wait for notification that the action has completed execution, which allows the action to perform an asynchronous operation.
- **willFinishRunning()**: Provides an opportunity for an action to perform cleanup operations, such as closing windows and deallocating memory.
- **stop()**: Stops the action from running.
- **reset()**: Resets the action to its initial state.
